Description: A hollow terracotta figure of Hathor, naked, with her hands to her sides. She has Isis-locks falling onto her shoulders, and wears an elaborate headdress of bound and leafy wreaths, with the ties hanging down beside her arms; it is surmounted by a large 'kalathos' with a notched upper edge: the surface of the 'kalathos' is eroded, and it may have had a Hathor/Isis crown in relief on the front. She has bracelets, an armlet on her left arm, and an anklet on her right leg. There is only summary treatment at the rear, including six long locks of hair, rather eroded. Circular vent. Two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt, with a dark-brown surface. Black paint on the hair in front; pale-pink traces on the lowest wreath.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: George Annesley, 2nd Earl of Mountnorris
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased from Arthur Lyttleton Annesley; it previously belonged to Viscount Valentia, an early traveller in Egypt. Ptolemaic, third to second century bc. Comparanda: Close: Ashmolean Museum, Oxford, no. 1896-1908.E7732, thought to be from Naukratis; Weber 1914: no. 201, from Abusir el-Mulak = Arslan 1997: 109, iii:24, dated second to third century ad; Sotheby’s ‘Sale Catalogue’, 14 July 1986: lot 327. Near: Breccia 1930: no. [172]; Christie’s ‘Sale Catalogue’, 16 July 1986: lot 256: hair restored?; Christie’s New York ‘Sale Catalogue’, 8 June 2001: lot 116; De Salvia 1995: 112, fig. 3 (feet only), from a house at Bacchias; Dunand 1979: no. 52 = LIMC v(2): pl. 517, Isis 258b; Dunand 1990: no. 328, from Antinoopolis = Del Francia Barocus 1998: 61, no. 22, dated second to third century ad; Perdrizet 1921: nos 1 and 3, from Mellawi in Middle Egypt, and no. 7, from the Fayum; Tsujimura 1998: 19, fig. 22:2 (lower legs only), from a Ptolemaic context at Akoris; Vogt 1924: pl. xcii. Near, wearing jewellery as registration nos. 1895,0511.49-50: Ashton et al. 2004: no. 30, dated second to first century bc.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (2995)
